title: Harvard head font
content:
Hello,  
I’d like to know what font is this [view attachment].

Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [harvard.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329120526/http:/typophile.com/files/harvard.gif) | 11.89 KB |
author: cuartopiso

comments.content:
Looks like Bembo. I’ll find the cut.

- Lex

Thank you Lex, the “r” and open “a” are identical to Bembo font.  
—  
carlos j roldan  
-cuartopiso

Just musing, but isn’t it interesting that Harvard uses Bembo and Yale uses Carter’s [interpretation](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329120526/http:/www.yale.edu/universityprinter/typeface/history.html) of the original Bembo text? What is it about that style that’s so alluring for them? I can think of a few reasons myself. From its [website](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329120526/http:/www.princeton.edu/main/about/), Princeton has forged a different path with what seem to be Baskerville and Helvetica.

The face used in the 2nd part of Princeton-logo doesn’t seem to be Helvetica.  
More something like Univers?
I’ll defer to you, Jelmar; I’m not so up on the distinctions between neo-grotesks.
